attr.pathogenesis: inhalation of fungal spores that transform into yeast form within host's lungs and disseminate
attr.complications: can affect respiratory, gastrointestinal, ocular, and neurological systems

reference: Molecular epidemiology of canine histoplasmosis in Japan - PubMed; Histoplasmosis in Animals - Infectious Diseases - Merck Veterinary Manual

attr.source: soil contaminated with bird and bat feces
attr.mechanism of action: transforms into yeast form within host's lungs and disseminates to other organs
